API Reference¶

top-level¶

schemas¶

class msvdd_bloc.schemas.ResumeSchema(*, only: Union[Sequence[str], Set[str]] = None, exclude: Union[Sequence[str], Set[str]] = (), many: bool = False, context: Dict = None, load_only: Union[Sequence[str], Set[str]] = (), dump_only: Union[Sequence[str], Set[str]] = (), partial: Union[bool, Sequence[str], Set[str]] = False, unknown: str = None)[source]¶

Standard schema for representing résumés as structured JSON data.

Example:

{
    "basics": {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "label": "Programmer",
        "email": "john@gmail.com",
        "phone": "(912) 555-4321",
        "website": "http://johndoe.com",
        "summary": "A summary of John Doe...",
        "location": {
            "address": "2712 Broadway St",
            "postalCode": "CA 94115",
            "city": "San Francisco",
            "countryCode": "US",
            "region": "California"
        },
        "profiles": [{
            "network": "Twitter",
            "username": "john",
            "url": "http://twitter.com/john"
        }]
    },
    "work": [{
        "company": "Company",
        "position": "President",
        "website": "http://company.com",
        "startDate": "2013-01-01",
        "endDate": "2014-01-01",
        "summary": "Description...",
        "highlights": [
            "Started the company"
        ]
    }],
    "volunteer": [{
        "organization": "Organization",
        "position": "Volunteer",
        "website": "http://organization.com/",
        "startDate": "2012-01-01",
        "endDate": "2013-01-01",
        "summary": "Description...",
        "highlights": [
            "Awarded 'Volunteer of the Month'"
        ]
    }],
    "education": [{
        "institution": "University",
        "area": "Software Development",
        "studyType": "Bachelor",
        "startDate": "2011-01-01",
        "endDate": "2013-01-01",
        "gpa": "4.0",
        "courses": [
            "DB1101 - Basic SQL"
        ]
    }],
    "awards": [{
        "title": "Award",
        "date": "2014-11-01",
        "awarder": "Company",
        "summary": "There is no spoon."
    }],
    "publications": [{
        "name": "Publication",
        "publisher": "Company",
        "releaseDate": "2014-10-01",
        "website": "http://publication.com",
        "summary": "Description..."
    }],
    "skills": [{
        "name": "Web Development",
        "level": "Master",
        "keywords": [
            "HTML",
            "CSS",
            "Javascript"
        ]
    }],
    "interests": [{
        "name": "Wildlife",
        "keywords": [
            "Ferrets",
            "Unicorns"
        ]
    }],
    "references": [{
        "name": "Jane Doe",
        "reference": "Reference..."
    }]
}

References

Based on https://jsonresume.org/schema/

    "location": {
        "address": "2712 Broadway St",
        "postalCode": "CA 94115",
        "city": "San Francisco",
        "countryCode": "US",
        "region": "California"
    },
    "profiles": [{
        "network": "Twitter",
        "username": "john",
        "url": "http://twitter.com/john"
    }]
}

Save multiple text files directly to a ZIP archive file.

Parameters

Yields

tokenize¶

Segment text into its constituent tokens using spaCy.

msvdd_bloc.tokenize.tokenize(line)[source]¶

Split line into a sequence of spaCy tokens, to be featurized.

Parameters

line (List[str] or str) – If str, text to be split into tokens. If List[str], it’s assumed that line was already tokenized at some point, so each str element is transformed into a token.

Returns

List[spacy.tokens.Token]

class msvdd_bloc.tokenize.PhoneNumberMerger(nlp)[source]¶

Custom spaCy pipeline component that merges contiguous tokens matching typical phone number patterns into a single token.

class msvdd_bloc.tokenize.DateRangeSplitter(nlp)[source]¶

Custom spaCy pipeline component that splits tokens matching a date range like YYYY–YYYY into separate tokens, which sneaks through the default tokenization rules.

regexes¶

utils¶

msvdd_bloc.utils.to_collection(val, val_type, col_type)[source]¶

Validate and cast a value or values to a collection.

Parameters

  • val (object) – Value or values to validate and cast.

  • val_type (type) – Type of each value in collection, e.g. int or str.

  • col_type (type) – Type of collection to return, e.g. tuple or set.

Returns

Collection of type col_type with values all of type val_type.

Return type

object

Raises

TypeError –

résumés¶

extract¶

Extract résumé text from a PDF file, using multiple methods applied in order of confidence.

msvdd_bloc.resumes.extract.extract_text_from_pdf(filepath, *, min_len=150)[source]¶

Extract text from a PDF at filepath using the first package to get the job done in extracting at least min_len chars.

Parameters

  • filepath (str) –

  • min_len (int) –

Returns

str

msvdd_bloc.resumes.extract.extract_text_from_pdf_tika(filepath)[source]¶

Extract text from a PDF at filepath using tika-python.

Parameters

filepath (str) –

Returns

str

msvdd_bloc.resumes.extract.extract_text_from_pdf_pdfminer(filepath)[source]¶

Extract text from a PDF at filepath using yapdfminer.

Parameters

filepath (str) –

Returns

str

Note

The external package used here — yapdfminer — has a convoluted provenance. It’s a fork of pdfminer3, which is a fork of pdfminer.six, which is a fork of pdfminer. Other forks also exist. Many are still used, but not many are still maintained.

msvdd_bloc.resumes.extract.extract_text_from_pdf_textract(filepath)[source]¶

Extract text from a PDF at filepath using textract + pdftotext.

Parameters

filepath (str) –

Returns

str

munge¶

Munge résumé text data: clean and normalize the text itself, and split it into content-bearing lines on a configurable delimiter.

msvdd_bloc.resumes.munge.normalize_text(text)[source]¶

Correct any encoding / mojibake / unicode weirdness, standardize list bullets, etc.

Parameters

text (str) –

Returns

str

msvdd_bloc.resumes.munge.get_filtered_text_lines(text, *, delim=' ?\\n')[source]¶

Split text into lines, filtering out some superfluous lines if context allows.

Parameters

  • text (str) –

  • delim (str) –

Returns

List[str]

Note

This should be applied to normalized text – see normalize_text().

segment¶

Segment résumé text lines into separate sections which (mostly) correspond to top-level fields in schemas.ResumeSchema().

msvdd_bloc.resumes.segment.SECTION_HEADERS = {'ambiguous': re.compile('^(?P<text>activities (and|&) honors|affiliations|awards, activities,? (and|&) additional skills|campus involvement|certifications|community involvement|involvement|involvement (and|&) achievements|le, re.IGNORECASE), 'awards': re.compile('^(?P<text>achievements|awards|awards (and|&) certifications|awards (and|&) honors|fellowships (and|&) awards|honors|honors (and|&) awards|honors, awards, (and|&) memberships)(?P<end>: |:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'basics': re.compile('^(?P<text>about|contacts?|(career|professional) (objective|summary)|(contact|personal) info|objective|summary)(?P<end>:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'education': re.compile('^(?P<text>academic qualifications|course ?work|courses completed|education|(recent|related|relevant|undergraduate) courses|(recent|related|relevant) course ?work)(?P<end>:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'interests': re.compile('^(?P<text>activities|activities (and|&) student groups|clubs|extracurriculars?|extracurricular activities|fellowships (and|&) clubs|(github|other|programming|recent|side|technical) projects|interests, re.IGNORECASE), 'publications': re.compile('^(?P<text>publications)(?P<end>:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'references': re.compile('^(?P<text>references)(?P<end>:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'skills': re.compile('^(?P<text>languages|languages? (and|&) technologies|programming languages|skills|skills (and|&) expertise|(relevant|soft|special|technical|technological) skills(et)?|technical strengths|tools)(?P<end, re.IGNORECASE), 'volunteer': re.compile('^(?P<text>community service|volunteer experiences?|volunteering)(?P<end>:?$)', re.IGNORECASE), 'work': re.compile('^(?P<text>(additional|leadership|professional|relevant|work) experiences?|employment|experiences?|leadership|leadership (and|&) service|professional development|work (and|&) (research|technical) expe, re.IGNORECASE)}¶

Mapping of section name to compiled regex pattern that matches header lines indicating the start of the corresponding section.

Type

Dict[str, re.Pattern]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.segment.get_section_lines(lines, keep_subheaders=True)[source]¶

Parse a sequence of text lines from a résumé into a mapping of section name to corresponding lines.

Parameters

  • List[str] – Cleaned and filtered résumé text lines, as output by resumes.munge.get_filtered_text_lines().

  • keep_subheaders (bool) – If True, don’t remove header text when a section header matches while already adding lines for the same section. In this situation, the header is probably a “sub-header”, and its text may be meaningful.

Returns

Dict[str, List[str]]

generate utils¶

Functionality for generating fake examples of labeled tokens for training a parser in a résumé section-agnostic manner. Section subpackages use and build upon these utils in their respective generate.py modules.

class msvdd_bloc.resumes.generate_utils.ResumeProvider(generator)[source]¶

Class for providing randomized field values in a résumé, regardless of section.

class msvdd_bloc.resumes.generate_utils.MarkovModel(state_len=4)[source]¶

Class to generate fake text using a Markov model trained on data. It’s not fancy, but it’s a big improvement over totally-random “lorem ipsum”!

fit(text)[source]¶
Parameters

text (str) –

Returns

The instantiated Markov model, trained.

Return type

MarkovModel

generate(n, state=None)[source]¶
Parameters

  • n (int) – Number of characters to generate.

  • state (str) – Initial state from which to start generating characters.

Returns

str

msvdd_bloc.resumes.generate_utils.generate_labeled_tokens(templates, fields, *, n=1, fixed_val_field_keys=None)[source]¶

Generate one or many fake examples by combining fields arranged as in templates with values and default labels specified by fields.

Parameters

  • templates (List[str] or List[Callable]) –

  • fields (Dict[str, Tuple[Callable, str]]) –

  • section (str) –

  • n (int) –

  • fixed_val_field_keys (str or Set[str]) –

Yields

List[Tuple[str, str]]

augment utils¶

Functionality for modifying sequences of labeled tokens for data augmentation purposes in a résumé section-agnostic manner. Section subpackages use and build upon these utils in their respective augment.py modules.

class msvdd_bloc.resumes.augment_utils.Augmenter(transforms, *, num=None)[source]¶

Randomly apply one or many data-augmentation transform functions to labeled tokens to produce new sequences with additional variety and/or noise in the data.

Parameters

  • transforms (Sequence[Callable]) –

    Ordered sequence of callables that must take List[Tuple[str, str]] as their first positional argument and return a new List[Tuple[str, str]].

    Note

    Although the particular transforms applied may vary per call, they are applied in order as listed here.

  • num (int or float or List[float]) – If int, number of transforms to randomly select from transforms each time Augmenter.apply() is called. If float, probability that any given transform will be selected. If List[float], probability that the corresponding transform in transforms will be selected (these must be the same length). If None (default), num is set to len(transforms), which means that all transforms are always applied.

apply(labeled_tokens, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sequentially apply some subset of augmentation transforms to labeled_tokens, returning a new, modified sequence of labeled tokens.

Parameters

labeled_tokens (List[Tuple[str, str]]) –

Returns

List[Tuple[str, str]]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.augment_utils.change_case_token_text(labeled_tokens, *, case='upper', target_labels=None)[source]¶

Change token text to case case for those whose label is in target_labels.

Parameters

  • labeled_tokens (List[Tuple[str, str]]) –

  • case ({"upper", "title", "lower"}) –

  • target_labels (str or Set[str]) –

Returns

List[Tuple[str, str]]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.augment_utils.delete_token(labeled_tokens, *, prob=0.01, target_labels=None)[source]¶

Randomly delete any given token with a probability of prob for those whose label is in target_labels.

Parameters

  • labeled_tokens (List[Tuple[str, str]]) –

  • prob (float) –

  • target_labels (str or Set[str]) –

Returns

List[Tuple[str, str]]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.augment_utils.insert_whitespace_token(labeled_tokens, *, prob=0.01, nrange=(1, 2), field_labels=('field_sep', 'item_sep'))[source]¶

Randomly insert a whitespace token between any given two tokens with a probability of prob, provided neither token is already whitespace.

Parameters

  • labeled_tokens (List[Tuple[str, str]]) –

  • prob (float) –

  • ngrange (Tuple[int, int]) –

  • field_labels (Tuple[str, str]) –

Returns

List[Tuple[str, str]]

parse utils¶

Functionality for tokenizing, featurizing, tagging, padding sequences, and loading taggers in a résumé section-agnostic manner. Section subpackages use and build upon these utils in their respective parse.py modules.

msvdd_bloc.resumes.parse_utils.load_tagger[source]¶
Parameters

fpath (str or pathlib.Path) –

Returns

pycrfsuite.Tagger

msvdd_bloc.resumes.parse_utils.get_token_features_base(token)[source]¶

Get base per-token features, independent of other tokens within its sequence. Specific sections should add to / remove from these features, as needed.

Parameters

token (spacy.tokens.Token) –

Returns

Dict[str, obj]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.parse_utils.pad_tokens_features(tokens_features, *, n_left=1, n_right=1)[source]¶

Pad list of tokens’ features on the left and/or right with a configurable number of dummy feature dicts.

Parameters

  • tokens_features (List[Dict[str, obj]]) –

  • n_left (int) – Number of dummy feature dicts to prepend.

  • n_right (int) – Number of dummy feature dicts to append.

Returns

List[Dict[str, obj]]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.parse_utils.get_line_token_idxs(tokens_features)[source]¶

Get the [start, stop) indexes for all lines in tokens_features, such that tokens_features[start : stop] corresponds to one line of featurized tokens.

Parameters

(List[Dict[str, obj]] (tokens_features) – Sequence of featurized tokens, as produced by get_token_features_base().

Yields

Tuple[int, int]

msvdd_bloc.resumes.parse_utils.tag(tokens, features, *, tagger)[source]¶

Tag each token in tokens with a section-specific label based on its features.

Parameters

  • tokens (List[spacy.tokens.Token]) – A tokenized line of text.

  • features (List[Dict[str, obj]]) – As output by a section-specific featurize().

  • tagger (pycrfsuite.Tagger) – Trained, section-specific CRF tagger.

Returns

Ordered sequence of (token, tag) pairs, aka “labeled tokens”.

Return type

List[Tuple[spacy.tokens.Token, str]]
